entities.description: A young hunter from Nevada who secretly arrives to assist John Ferrier and Lucy.

entities.name: Lucy
entities.description: John Ferrier's daughter, who is unaware of the full danger they are in.

entities.name: The Council

entities.name: Nevada
entities.description: The state where Jefferson Hope originates from.

entities.name: The settlement
entities.description: The area surrounded by mountains where John Ferrier lives, under the watch of The Council.

entities.name: The countdown numbers

entities.name: The month of grace
entities.description: The allotted time period during which John Ferrier is under threat, marked by a countdown.

entities.name: John Ferrier's house
entities.description: The house where John Ferrier lives and keeps watch, where the countdown numbers appear.

relationships.description: John Ferrier waits for the arrival of Jefferson Hope for assistance.
Jefferson Hope arrives to help John Ferrier against the threats.
The Council imposes restrictions and surveillance on John Ferrier.
The Council watches and guards the settlement and roads.
The daily numbers mark a countdown that threatens John Ferrier.
John Ferrier is determined to protect his daughter from dishonor.
Jefferson Hope asks about Lucy's well-being upon arrival.
Jefferson Hope is a hunter from Nevada.
John Ferrier lives in and guards his house.
The numbers are painted on the door or walls of the house.

entities.name: John Ferrier
entities.description: The farmer, father of Lucy, who is planning to escape with his daughter and Jefferson Hope.

entities.name: Lucy Ferrier
entities.description: John Ferrier's daughter, loved by Jefferson Hope, escaping with her father and Hope.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: The young hunter from Washoe, in love with Lucy, helping the Ferriers escape from Utah.

entities.name: Brother Drebber

entities.name: Utah
entities.description: The state where the Ferriers and Jefferson Hope are located, from which they are fleeing.

entities.name: Carson City
entities.description: The destination city through the mountains that the group aims to reach.

entities.name: The Mountains
entities.description: The mountainous terrain through which the group must travel to reach Carson City.

entities.name: Ferrier's House

entities.name: The High Road

entities.name: The Town

entities.name: Bag of Gold and Notes
entities.description: The money carried by Ferrier for the escape, consisting of two thousand dollars in gold and five in notes.

entities.name: Revolver
entities.description: The firearm carried by Jefferson Hope for protection during the escape.

entities.name: Provisions and Water
entities.description: The scanty eatables and water packed by Jefferson Hope for the journey through the mountains.

entities.name: Lucy's Bundle
entities.description: A small bundle containing Lucy's more valued possessions, carried by her during the escape.

entities.name: Mule and Horses
entities.description: The transportation animals waiting in Eagle Ravine for the escape.

entities.name: To-night
entities.description: The time when they must act to escape, or else be lost.

entities.name: Midnight
entities.description: The time mentioned by the sentinels for an event, specifically 'To-morrow at midnight'.

entities.name: Daybreak

relationships.description: Jefferson Hope helps John Ferrier escape from Utah.
Jefferson Hope is in love with Lucy Ferrier and risks his life to save her.
John Ferrier is the father of Lucy Ferrier.
John Ferrier lives at the house which he is about to abandon.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: The hunter leading the escape of Lucy and Ferrier, knowledgeable about the mountains and the countersign.

entities.name: Lucy Ferrier
entities.description: The young woman escaping with her father and Jefferson Hope, placed on a mule.

entities.name: John Ferrier
entities.description: Lucy's father, an old man carrying a money-bag, escaping the Mormons.

entities.name: The Saints
entities.description: The Mormons, a religious group with jurisdiction over the area, from whom the fugitives are fleeing.

entities.name: The Holy Four
entities.description: The highest authority in the Mormon hierarchy, referenced by Ferrier to gain passage.

entities.name: The Avenging Angels
entities.description: A group implied by the chapter title, likely pursuing the fugitives.

entities.name: Nevada
entities.description: The stated destination of the fugitives, representing freedom.

entities.name: Carson
entities.description: A town in Nevada where the fugitives hope to find safety and rest.

entities.name: Mountain Pass
entities.description: The wild and desolate portion of the route where the sentinel is posted.

entities.name: Money-bag
entities.description: Ferrier's bag of money, taken during the escape.

entities.name: Rifle
entities.description: Jefferson Hope's firearm, carried on his saddle for protection.

entities.name: Gun
entities.description: The sentinel's firearm, which he fingers when challenging the fugitives.

entities.name: Horses and Mule
entities.description: The animals used for transportation, picketed in Eagle Caon.

entities.name: All night
entities.description: The duration of travel through defiles and rocky paths.

entities.name: Morning
entities.description: When the sun rose and lit the mountain peaks, cheering the fugitives.

entities.name: Evening

entities.name: Before daybreak
entities.description: The time they resumed their journey after a short rest.

relationships.description: Jefferson Hope guides Lucy Ferrier through the mountains to escape.
Jefferson Hope guides John Ferrier through the mountains to escape.

Jefferson Hope leads the other horse along the path.

Jefferson Hope and the fugitives travel through the mountain pass.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: The hunter and guide who is fleeing with Lucy and the old man from the Mormons; he goes hunting to procure food during their flight.

entities.name: Lucy
entities.description: The young girl fleeing with Jefferson Hope and the old man; she is left at the camp while Hope goes hunting.

entities.name: Old Man
entities.description: The elderly man, father of Lucy, fleeing with Jefferson Hope; he is left at the camp while Hope goes hunting.

entities.name: The Mormons
entities.description: The religious organization from which Jefferson Hope, Lucy, and the old man are fleeing; they are the pursuers referred to as 'the terrible organization'.

entities.name: The Defile Camp
entities.description: The camp site in a defile where Jefferson Hope leaves Lucy and the old man by a fire; later he returns to find them gone.

entities.name: The Valley
entities.description: The valley in the mountains where Jefferson Hope hunts for game; it has many ravines and gorges.

entities.name: The Jutting Pinnacle
entities.description: A high rock formation where the big-horn sheep was standing, several hundred feet above Jefferson Hope.

entities.name: Rifle
entities.description: Jefferson Hope's firearm which he uses to hunt the big-horn.

entities.description: A sheep-like animal with gigantic horns that Jefferson Hope shoots in the mountains; it provides meat for the group.

entities.name: Haunch and Flank
entities.description: The cut of meat from the big-horn that Jefferson Hope carries back to camp.

entities.description: The fire made at the sheltered nook in the defile to warm Lucy and the old man; later only its ashes remain.

entities.name: Wood Ashes
entities.description: The remains of the campfire found by Jefferson Hope upon his return, indicating the fire had not been tended.

entities.name: The Second Day of Flight
entities.description: The second day since Jefferson Hope, Lucy, and the old man began fleeing from the Mormons.

entities.name: Nearly Five Hours
entities.description: The duration of Jefferson Hope's absence from the camp while hunting.

entities.name: The Disappearance
entities.description: The sudden and terrible disaster that occurred during Jefferson Hope's absence, resulting in the disappearance of Lucy and the old man from the camp.

relationships.description: Jefferson Hope is fleeing from the pursuit of the Mormon organization.
Lucy is fleeing from the Mormons along with Jefferson Hope and the old man.
The old man is fleeing from the Mormons along with Jefferson Hope and Lucy.
Jefferson Hope is traveling with Lucy as companions in flight.
Jefferson Hope is traveling with the old man as companions in flight.
Lucy and the old man are together at the camp while Hope is hunting.

Jefferson Hope searches for game in the valley.
The disappearance of Lucy and the old man occurred at the defile camp.
Lucy is a victim of the disappearance disaster.
The old man is a victim of the disappearance disaster.
The disappearance happened during the nearly five hours that Jefferson Hope was absent.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: A hunter and former suitor of Lucy Ferrier, who discovers the abandoned camp and John Ferrier's grave, vows revenge on the Mormons.

entities.name: John Ferrier
entities.description: The old farmer who fled Salt Lake City with his daughter Lucy, found dead and buried at the campsite.

entities.name: Lucy Ferrier
entities.description: John Ferrier's daughter, captured by the Mormon pursuers and taken back to Salt Lake City to become part of a harem.

entities.name: Salt Lake City
entities.description: The city inhabited by the Mormons, from which the Ferriers fled and to which the pursuers returned.

entities.name: The camp
entities.description: The temporary campsite where Jefferson Hope left the Ferriers, now abandoned with a smoldering fire and a grave.

entities.name: The grave
entities.description: A newly-dug grave with a stick and paper inscription marking John Ferrier's burial place.

entities.name: The stick with paper inscription
entities.description: A stick planted on the grave with a paper noting John Ferrier's death date.

entities.name: August 4th, 1860
entities.description: The date of John Ferrier's death as inscribed on the grave marker.

entities.name: The avenging angels
entities.description: A group of mounted Mormon enforcers who pursued the Ferriers.

entities.name: Eagle Canyon
entities.description: A canyon from which Hope views Salt Lake City on the sixth day of his return journey.

entities.name: Cowper
entities.description: A Mormon whom Hope meets near Eagle Canyon, who warns him about the warrant.

entities.name: The Holy Four
entities.description: A council of Mormon leaders who issued a warrant against Jefferson Hope for assisting the Ferriers' escape.

entities.name: The Mormons
entities.description: The religious community in Salt Lake City from which the Ferriers fled and who captured Lucy.

entities.name: The horses' tracks
entities.description: Tracks on the ground showing that a large party of mounted men overtook the fugitives.

entities.name: The fire
entities.description: The smoldering fire at the campsite, which Hope uses to cook food.

entities.name: The food
entities.description: Food that Hope cooks and bundles for his journey back.

entities.name: The rifle
entities.description: Hope's rifle, which he uses for support and possibly as a weapon.

entities.name: The mountains
entities.description: The mountain range through which Hope travels back to Salt Lake City.

entities.name: The flags and festivity signs
entities.description: Flags and signs of festivity observed in Salt Lake City from Eagle Canyon.

relationships.description: Jefferson Hope returns to the camp to find it abandoned.
Hope discovers a newly-dug grave at the camp.
John Ferrier's body is buried in the grave.
The grave is located at the campsite.
Lucy was captured by the Mormon pursuers and taken back to Salt Lake City.
Hope vows to devote his life to revenge against the Mormons for capturing Lucy and causing John's death.
After five days of travel, Hope reaches Eagle Canyon.
From Eagle Canyon, Hope looks down upon Salt Lake City.
Hope meets the Mormon Cowper near Eagle Canyon.
Cowper warns Hope that there is a warrant against him from the Holy Four.
The Holy Four issued a warrant for Hope's arrest for assisting the Ferriers.
The avenging angels pursued and overtook John Ferrier.
The avenging angels pursued and captured Lucy Ferrier.
The tracks show that a large party of mounted men overtook the fugitives.
Hope leans on his rifle for support.

The stick with paper serves as a grave marker.
Hope travels back through the mountains.
Hope observes flags and signs of festivity in Salt Lake City.
The tracks show the pursuers turned back to Salt Lake City.

entities.name: Cowper
entities.description: A Mormon who warns Jefferson Hope about the warrant from the Holy Four and informs him of Lucy Ferrier's marriage.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: A man in love with Lucy Ferrier; after her death, he becomes a vengeful hermit living in the mountains, attempting to kill Drebber and Stangerson.

entities.name: Lucy Ferrier
entities.description: Daughter of John Ferrier; forced to marry Enoch Drebber, she dies of despair within a month.

entities.name: Enoch Drebber
entities.description: A Mormon who marries Lucy Ferrier primarily for her father's property; later targeted by Jefferson Hope for vengeance.

entities.name: Joseph Stangerson
entities.description: A Mormon who shot John Ferrier and rivaled Drebber for Lucy's hand; later targeted by Jefferson Hope.

entities.name: John Ferrier
entities.description: Father of Lucy Ferrier; shot and killed by Joseph Stangerson.

entities.name: The Prophet
entities.description: The leader of the Mormons who decides to give Lucy Ferrier to Enoch Drebber in marriage.

entities.name: The Holy Four
entities.description: A council within the Mormons that issued a warrant against Jefferson Hope for assisting the Ferriers.

entities.name: The Mormons
entities.description: The religious group to which Cowper, Drebber, Stangerson, and the Prophet belong; their customs include polygamy and communal decisions.

entities.name: The Endowment House
entities.description: The building where Lucy Ferrier and Enoch Drebber were married, indicated by flags flying for the ceremony.

entities.name: The Mountains
entities.description: The remote mountain region where Jefferson Hope hides and lives a wild life after Lucy's death, planning his vengeance.

entities.name: The City
entities.description: The city (likely Salt Lake City) where tales of Jefferson Hope's prowling in the suburbs and mountain gorges are told.

entities.name: The Wedding-ring
entities.description: The gold ring taken from Lucy Ferrier's finger by Jefferson Hope to prevent her burial with it; symbolizes her forced marriage.

entities.name: Murder of John Ferrier
entities.description: The killing of John Ferrier by Joseph Stangerson, which gave Stangerson a claim to Lucy Ferrier according to Mormon council.

entities.name: Attempted Murder of Stangerson
entities.description: Jefferson Hope's attempt to kill Joseph Stangerson by shooting a bullet through his window.

entities.name: Attempted Murder of Drebber
entities.description: Jefferson Hope's attempt to kill Enoch Drebber by causing a boulder to fall on him from a cliff.

relationships.description: Hope questions Cowper about Lucy Ferrier's whereabouts and the situation.
Cowper is a Mormon subject to the authority of the Holy Four, which issued a warrant against Hope.
Hope is deeply in love with Lucy Ferrier and is devastated by her forced marriage and death.
Lucy was forced to marry Enoch Drebber under the decision of the Mormon Prophet.
Stangerson shot and killed John Ferrier during the pursuit of the Ferriers.
The Prophet gave Lucy Ferrier to Enoch Drebber in marriage after council arguments.
After Lucy's death, Hope lives in the mountains, hiding from the Mormons and nursing his vengeance.
Hope takes the wedding-ring from Lucy's finger to prevent her burial with it.
The wedding-ring was on Lucy Ferrier's finger after her marriage to Drebber.
Hope tries to kill Stangerson by shooting a bullet through his window.
Hope tries to kill Drebber by causing a boulder to fall on him from a cliff.
The murder of John Ferrier was committed by Joseph Stangerson.
John Ferrier is the victim of the murder committed by Stangerson.
The attempted murder of Stangerson was carried out by Jefferson Hope.
The attempted murder of Drebber was carried out by Jefferson Hope.
Lucy's marriage to Drebber took place at the Endowment House, indicated by flags.
Hope is seen prowling around the suburbs of the City, haunting mountain gorges.
The Holy Four is a council within the larger Mormon organization.
Drebber married Lucy Ferrier primarily to gain possession of John Ferrier's property.
Stangerson contended with Drebber to marry Lucy Ferrier, claiming precedence after killing her father.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: The avenger who pursues Drebber and Stangerson for past wrongs; practical and persistent, he travels across the United States and Europe to track them; captured by Sherlock Holmes after a struggle.

entities.name: John Ferrier
entities.description: Deceased figure whose grave Jefferson Hope visited; his wrongs are part of Hope's motivation for revenge.

entities.name: Enoch Drebber
entities.description: One of the men Jefferson Hope seeks; a former Mormon who left the Church, converted property to money, and fled with Stangerson to Europe; recognized Hope in Cleveland and alerted authorities.

entities.name: Stangerson
entities.description: Accomplice of Drebber and his private secretary; fled with Drebber from Salt Lake City to Europe; comparatively poor.

entities.name: Sherlock Holmes
entities.description: The detective who captures Jefferson Hope; loosens the towel binding Hope's ankles and takes him to the police-station.

entities.name: John Watson
entities.description: The narrator and doctor; observes the prisoner's physical strength and demeanor during the capture.

entities.name: Gregson
entities.description: A detective present at the capture of Jefferson Hope; exchanges glances with Lestrade at the prisoner's bold proposition.

entities.name: Lestrade
entities.description: A detective present at the capture; works with Gregson and Holmes.

entities.name: Nevada mines
entities.description: Mining area in Nevada where Jefferson Hope worked to regain his health and amass money for his pursuit of revenge.

entities.name: Salt Lake City
entities.description: City in Utah where Jefferson Hope returned to find Drebber and Stangerson, only to discover they had left after a schism in the Mormon church.

entities.name: Utah
entities.description: State where Salt Lake City is located; original home of the Mormon settlement from which Drebber and Stangerson fled.

entities.name: United States
entities.description: Country through which Jefferson Hope traveled from town to town in search of his enemies.

entities.name: Cleveland, Ohio
entities.description: City in Ohio where Jefferson Hope spotted Drebber and Stangerson through a window, leading to his plan of vengeance.

entities.name: Europe
entities.description: Continent to which Drebber and Stangerson fled; Hope followed them there, tracking them through several cities.

entities.name: St. Petersburg
entities.description: City in Russia where Hope tracked his enemies, but they had already departed for Paris.

entities.name: Paris
entities.description: City in France where Hope followed Drebber and Stangerson, but they had just set off for Copenhagen.

entities.name: Copenhagen
entities.description: Capital of Denmark where Hope was again a few days late, as his enemies had journeyed on to London.

entities.name: London
entities.description: City in England where Jefferson Hope finally tracked down Drebber and Stangerson and was subsequently captured by Sherlock Holmes.

entities.name: Police-station
entities.description: The station to which Jefferson Hope assumes he will be taken after capture.

entities.name: John Ferrier's Grave
entities.description: The gravesite of John Ferrier, which Jefferson Hope visited on a memorable night, solidifying his resolve for revenge.

entities.name: The Chosen People
entities.description: The religious group, likely the Mormons, to which Drebber and Stangerson belonged before the schism.

entities.name: The Church
entities.description: The Mormon church from which some younger members rebelled against the Elders.

entities.name: The Elders
entities.description: The authority figures of the Mormon church against whom some younger members rebelled.

entities.name: Gentiles
entities.description: Former members of the Mormon church who seceded and left Utah to become non-Mormons.

relationships.description: Jefferson Hope travels extensively to track down and take revenge on Enoch Drebber.
Jefferson Hope seeks Stangerson as part of his revenge for past wrongs.
Hope's quest for revenge is driven by the wrongs done to John Ferrier and his daughter.
Drebber and Stangerson flee together from Salt Lake City and travel to Europe.
Drebber left Salt Lake City after the schism in the Mormon church.
Stangerson also departed from Salt Lake City with Drebber.
Hope returned to Salt Lake City to find his enemies, but they had already left.
Hope worked in the Nevada mines to recruit his health and amass money for his pursuit.
In Cleveland, Ohio, Hope saw Drebber and Stangerson through a window, confirming their location.
Drebber was in Cleveland, Ohio, where he recognized Hope in the street.
Stangerson was also in Cleveland, Ohio, with Drebber.
Drebber fled to Europe to escape Jefferson Hope.
Stangerson also fled to Europe with Drebber.
Hope followed his enemies to Europe, tracking them through several cities.
Hope traveled to St. Petersburg in pursuit, but his enemies had left for Paris.
Drebber passed through St. Petersburg on his way to Paris.
Stangerson also traveled through St. Petersburg with Drebber.
Hope followed his enemies to Paris, but they had departed for Copenhagen.
Drebber traveled to Paris after St. Petersburg.
Stangerson traveled to Paris with Drebber.
Hope traveled to Copenhagen, but was again a few days late as his enemies had gone to London.
Drebber passed through Copenhagen on his way to London.
Stangerson also traveled through Copenhagen with Drebber.
Hope finally tracked his enemies to London, where he eventually caught up with them.
Drebber fled to London, where he was ultimately tracked by Hope.
Stangerson also fled to London with Drebber.
Sherlock Holmes captures Jefferson Hope after a struggle and takes him into custody.
Dr. Watson observes the prisoner Jefferson Hope's physical strength and demeanor.
Detective Gregson is present at the capture of Jefferson Hope.
Detective Lestrade is present at the capture of Jefferson Hope.
Drebber was originally a member of The Chosen People (Mormons) before the schism.
Stangerson was also a member of The Chosen People before leaving.
After leaving Utah, Drebber became a Gentile (non-Mormon).
Stangerson also became a Gentile after seceding from the Mormon church.
The Elders are the authority figures who lead the Mormon church.
Hope assumes he will be taken to the police-station after his capture.
Hope visited John Ferrier's grave on a memorable night, which solidified his resolve for revenge.

entities.name: Jefferson Hope
entities.description: The prisoner captured by Sherlock Holmes; confesses to the murders of Enoch Drebber and Joseph Stangerson; suffers from an aortic aneurism.

entities.name: Sherlock Holmes
entities.description: The detective who tracked down Jefferson Hope; leads the investigation and captures the prisoner.

entities.name: John Watson
entities.description: Dr. Watson, the narrator; examines Jefferson Hope's medical condition and diagnoses his aortic aneurism.

entities.name: Lestrade
entities.description: A detective from Scotland Yard who drives the cab to the police station.

entities.name: Gregson
entities.description: A detective from Scotland Yard who accompanies Holmes inside the cab.

entities.name: Enoch Drebber
entities.description: One of the murder victims; forced Lucy Ferrier to marry him, leading to her death.

entities.name: Salt Lake Mountains
entities.description: Mountain range where Jefferson Hope suffered over-exposure and under-feeding, causing his aortic aneurism.

entities.name: Marriage Ring
entities.description: The wedding ring taken from Lucy Ferrier's dead finger; used by Hope to make Drebber see it before his death.

entities.name: Lestrade's Note-book
entities.description: The notebook used by Lestrade to record Jefferson Hope's confession verbatim.

entities.name: The Murders of Enoch Drebber and Joseph Stangerson
entities.description: The murders for which Jefferson Hope is arrested; motivated by revenge for the deaths of John Ferrier and Lucy Ferrier.

relationships.description: Holmes tracked and captured Jefferson Hope, leading to his arrest.
Hope killed Enoch Drebber as revenge for forcing Lucy Ferrier to marry him.

relationships.target: The Murders of Enoch Drebber and Joseph Stangerson
relationships.description: Hope is the perpetrator of the murders of Drebber and Stangerson.
Dr. Watson diagnoses Hope's aortic aneurism during the interrogation.
Hope developed an aortic aneurism from over-exposure and under-feeding in the Salt Lake Mountains.
Hope made Drebber look at the marriage ring before killing him, as a symbol of revenge.
Lestrade's notebook contains the verbatim confession of Jefferson Hope.
Gregson rides inside the cab with Holmes to the police station.
Lestrade drives the cab that takes Holmes and the others to the police station.
Hope took the marriage ring from Lucy Ferrier's dead finger and kept it.

entities.name: The Narrator
entities.description: The speaker who avenges his fiance by killing Drebber and Stangerson; he was engaged to the girl twenty years ago.

entities.name: Drebber
entities.description: The man who forced the narrator's fiance to marry him; later murdered by the narrator.

entities.name: Stangerson
entities.description: Drebber's accomplice; also murdered by the narrator.

entities.name: The Girl
entities.description: The narrator's fiance who was forced to marry Drebber and died of a broken heart.

entities.name: London
entities.description: The city where the narrator tracks down Drebber and Stangerson.

entities.name: Camberwell
entities.description: A district in London where Drebber and Stangerson lived in a boarding-house.

entities.name: Torquay Terrace
entities.description: The street in which Drebber and Stangerson boarded, where the narrator drove up and down.

entities.name: Euston Station
entities.description: The railway station where Drebber and Stangerson went to catch a train to Liverpool.

entities.name: Hallidays Private Hotel
entities.description: The hotel where Stangerson was to wait for Drebber if he missed the last train.

entities.name: The River
entities.description: The river (likely Thames) that Camberwell is on the other side of.

entities.name: The Marriage Ring
entities.description: The wedding ring taken from the dead finger of the narrator's fiance, which the narrator carried to show Drebber before his death.

entities.name: Cabowners Office
entities.description: The office where the narrator applied for a job as a cab driver.

entities.name: The Murder of Drebber and Stangerson
